bill_title: revise provisions for the sale of tax deeds and to grant the prior owner of a property entitlement to proceeds from the sale of tax deeds.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to revise provisions for the sale of tax deeds and to grant the prior owner of a property entitlement to proceeds from the sale of tax deeds. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That chapter 10-25 be amended with a NEW SECTION: Following a sale of a tax deed, the tax certificate holder is entitled to collect the amount of taxes, penalty, interest, and other costs. Any remaining moneys from the sale of the tax deed must be returned to the person who owned the property immediately prior to the sale of the tax deed for the property. If the prior owner cannot be found within one year, the remaining moneys must be deposited in the county general fund.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
